intro: Pereskia plantaginea, commonly known as the hibiscus cactus, is a unique plant that bridges the characteristics of cacti and flowering plants. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant features thick, fleshy stems covered in soft, leaf-like structures, which are actually modified leaves. Its flowers are showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen, typically in shades of yellow or orange. The plant produces small, green, berry-like fruits that contain seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
